meanings.definition: (adjective) Having a conservative or old-fashioned mindset.
meanings.sent1: The mossbacked gentleman preferred traditional values over modern trends.
meanings.sent2: She always felt comfortable in her mossbacked ways, sticking to what she knew.
meanings.sent3: The mossbacked cat refused to try the new scratching post, clinging to its old one.
meanings.sent4: His mossbacked views on technology made him seem like a relic from a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The mossbacked oak tree stood tall, unmoved by the changing seasons.

meanings.definition: (noun) A person who is resistant to change or progress.
meanings.sent1: The town's mossbacked was known for opposing any alterations to the main street.
meanings.sent2: As a mossbacked, she was often seen as a hindrance to innovation.
meanings.sent3: The mossbacked at the office always grumbled about new procedures.
meanings.sent4: He was a mossbacked when it came to trying new foods, sticking to his favorites.
meanings.sent5: The old mossbacked was the last to embrace the new community center.

meanings.definition: (verb) To resist or oppose new ideas or ways of thinking.
meanings.sent1: She would always mossbacked any suggestions for change in the book club.
meanings.sent2: The group decided to mossbacked the proposal to switch meeting times.
meanings.sent3: He tried to mossbacked the idea of a team outing, but everyone was excited.
meanings.sent4: The teacher mossbacked the use of technology in the classroom, preferring traditional methods.
meanings.sent5: The company's CEO continued to mossbacked the shift towards remote work.
